results.title: beta1 antagonist and beta2 agonist, celiprolol, restores the impaired endothelial dependent and independent responses and decreased TNFalpha in rat with type II diabetes.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Evans_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C536380 @@@OLETF@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were fed regular chow with or without @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (25 mg/kg/day) or @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@celiprolol@@@ (100 mg/kg/day) treatment (group @<m>DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@DM@@@, no treatment; group DM-a, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment; group @<m>DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@DM@@@-c, @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@celiprolol@@@ treatment), and treatment was continued for 31 days.

citations.NLM: Hayashi T, Juliet PA, Miyazaki-Akita A, Funami J, Matsui-Hirai H, Fukatsu A, Iguchi A. beta1 antagonist and beta2 agonist, celiprolol, restores the impaired endothelial dependent and independent responses and decreased TNFalpha in rat with type II diabetes. Life Sci. 2007 Jan 16;80(6):592-9. PMID: 17141277
